title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
Fourth-quarter profit fell 14% at JPMorgan and 26% at Citigroup, ending what had been a streak of big gains for most of 2021. Revenue didn't budge much, but expenses rose.

---

U.S. retail spending and manufacturing slowed at the end of 2021 as the Covid-19 Omicron variant and inflation surged.

---

Google misled publishers and advertisers for years about the pricing and processes of its ad auctions, according to allegations in a lawsuit by state attorneys general.

---

The stock market's winter selloff deepened this past week, pushing the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow further into the red for 2022.

---

Imagine Entertainment, the film and TV production company co-founded by Ron Howard and Brian Grazer, is in talks to sell a majority stake to investment firm Centricus.

---

Martin Shkreli, who was widely criticized as "pharma bro" for raising the price of a lifesaving AIDS drug, was banned for life from the pharmaceutical industry.
